docs.lead_paragraph: North Dakota's sole abortion clinic has settled a lawsuit it filed over a new law requiring doctors who perform abortions to obtain hospital-admitting privileges, officials said Friday.

headline.main: APNewsBreak: North Dakota Abortion Lawsuit Settled
headline.print_headline: APNewsBreak: North Dakota Abortion Lawsuit Settled

docs.snippet: North Dakota's sole abortion clinic has settled a lawsuit it filed over a new law requiring doctors who perform abortions to obtain hospital-admitting privileges, officials said Friday.

headline.main: How to Shave $1 Trillion Out of Health Care

docs.abstract: Shaving $1 trillion out of health care costs would not reduce health outcomes, but would provide many other benefits, writes an economist.
docs.snippet: Shaving $1 trillion out of health care costs would not reduce health outcomes, but would provide many other benefits, writes an economist.

docs.lead_paragraph: Debate over a powerful new painkiller ratcheted up Thursday as the head of the Food and Drug Administration defended the drug's approval and a West Virginia Senator responded with a bill to force it off the market.

headline.main: FDA Chief Defends Zohydro as Criticism Intensifies
headline.print_headline: FDA Chief Defends Zohydro as Criticism Intensifies

docs.snippet: Debate over a powerful new painkiller ratcheted up Thursday as the head of the Food and Drug Administration defended the drug's approval and a West Virginia Senator responded with a bill to force it off the market.

docs.lead_paragraph: A type of Medicare in which private insurers provide coverage remains attractive to Americans, but proposed reductions in government payments may change the benefits offered.

headline.main: Medicare Changes Prompt Enrollees to Reconsider Plans
headline.print_headline: Medicare Changes Prompt Enrollees to Reconsider Plans

docs.abstract: Changes to payments made by the federal government to Medicare Advantage insurers contained within the health care reform law have set some Medicare Advantage subscribers scrambling.
docs.snippet: A type of Medicare in which private insurers provide coverage remains attractive to Americans, but proposed reductions in government payments may change the benefits offered.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: - As the U.S. Supreme Court prepares to hear a religious dispute over the Obamacare contraception mandate, advocates on both sides are trying to set the court straight on the science.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court Case Highlights Unsettled Science in Contraception
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court Case Highlights Unsettled Science in Contraception

docs.snippet: - As the U.S. Supreme Court prepares to hear a religious dispute over the Obamacare contraception mandate, advocates on both sides are trying to set the court straight on the science.

docs.lead_paragraph: How humankind unwittingly joined an experiment on antibiotics and weight gain.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Pagan Kennedy traces link between widespread use of antibiotics in America and increase in obesity rates; notes that scientists have found evidence that suggests that antibiotic usage may alter the humans' microbiomes, which in turn could be related to heavier population and rise in obesity.
docs.snippet: How humankind unwittingly joined an experiment on antibiotics and weight gain.
